title: Improve error messages for borrowing in match arms

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.

If you cannot produce a minimal reproduction case (something that would work in
isolation), please provide the steps or even link to a repository that causes
the problematic output to occur.
-->
When I match a mutable reference of `foo`:
1. Use part of the `foo` only in one match arm (the link is in use longer than the match itself, otherwise everything compiles). 
2. While in the other, there's no direct usage and I want to borrow `foo` again. 

The compiler gives the error "cannot borrow `foo` as mutable more than once at a time".
```rust
match &mut foo.data {
    Some(value) => Some(value),
    None => {
        foo.data = Some(35);
        None
    }
}
```

 It would be great if the compiler could understand that I only need a part of this and would suggest using `ref mut` in match arm:

```rust
match foo.data {
    Some(ref mut value) => Some(value),
    None => {
        foo.data = Some(35);
        None
    }
}
```

[Playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=b5bfe4c287ad39f70225f836caaeff28)


Many thanks to @bugaevc for pushing me to report this and and simplifying the example :)
